pull.title: ci, windows: Do not run extended functional tests for pull requests
pull.body:
This PR is intended to speed up the CI feedback for pull requests:

- a [PR](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/actions/runs/6019964104?pr=28196) opened against the current master branch:
![image](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/assets/32963518/481a70eb-13f3-40c9-8f6a-ca2f06350158)

- this PR:
![image](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/assets/32963518/2582307f-7b72-4816-b5be-e84d5e4a3016)


Suggested in https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/28173#discussion_r1302929493:

> An alternative would be to run them on non-pr pushes only. Failures should be rare enough to deal with them post-merge.

events.body:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--021abf342d371248e50ceaed478a90ca-->
### Reviews
See [the guideline](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#code-review) for information on the review process.
| Type | Reviewers |
| ---- | --------- |
| ACK | [MarcoFalke](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/28360#issuecomment-1699012564) |

If your review is incorrectly listed, please react with ðŸ‘Ž to this comment and the bot will ignore it on the next update.

tree 84a157ede6345fca3fae3c6cc2aa53c04f4e6ee1
parent ab42b2ebdbf61225e636e4c00068fd29b2790d41
author Hennadii Stepanov <32963518+hebasto@users.noreply.github.com> 1693392407 +0100
committer Hennadii Stepanov <32963518+hebasto@users.noreply.github.com> 1693392407 +0100

ci, windows: Do not run extended functional tests for pull requests

This change is intended to speed up the CI feedback for pull requests.

events.message:
ci, windows: Do not run extended functional tests for pull requests

This change is intended to speed up the CI feedback for pull requests.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -262,5 +262,7 @@ jobs:
         run: py -3 test\util\rpcauth-test.py
 
       - name: Run functional tests
+        env:
+          TEST_RUNNER_EXTRA: ${{ github.event_name != 'pull_request' && '--extended --exclude feature_dbcrash' || '' }}
comments.body:
```suggestion
          TEST_RUNNER_EXTRA: ${{ github.event_name != 'pull_request' && '--extended' || '' }}
```

If there is a reason to exclude this, it should be mentioned

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -262,5 +262,7 @@ jobs:
         run: py -3 test\util\rpcauth-test.py
 
       - name: Run functional tests
+        env:
+          TEST_RUNNER_EXTRA: ${{ github.event_name != 'pull_request' && '--extended --exclude feature_dbcrash' || '' }}
comments.body:
Are we OK with an increased [runtime](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/actions/runs/6023862001):

![image](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/assets/32963518/0b43f513-f4f5-49dc-bd3d-f782c2498257)
?

       - name: Run functional tests
+        env:
+          TEST_RUNNER_EXTRA: ${{ github.event_name != 'pull_request' && '--extended --exclude feature_dbcrash' || '' }}

@@ -262,5 +262,7 @@ jobs:
         run: py -3 test\util\rpcauth-test.py
 
       - name: Run functional tests
+        env:
+          TEST_RUNNER_EXTRA: ${{ github.event_name != 'pull_request' && '--extended --exclude feature_dbcrash' || '' }}
comments.body: If there are any downsides, you can skip the functional tests on the master branch completely  on `job_id % n == 0`, where `n` is the down-scaling factor, but then run them completely otherwise?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -262,5 +262,7 @@ jobs:
         run: py -3 test\util\rpcauth-test.py
 
       - name: Run functional tests
+        env:
+          TEST_RUNNER_EXTRA: ${{ github.event_name != 'pull_request' && '--extended --exclude feature_dbcrash' || '' }}
comments.body: It takes one runner busy approximately twice longer than other runners. Of course, not a big deal, considering we are provided with 20 runners.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -262,5 +262,7 @@ jobs:
         run: py -3 test\util\rpcauth-test.py
 
       - name: Run functional tests
+        env:
+          TEST_RUNNER_EXTRA: ${{ github.event_name != 'pull_request' && '--extended --exclude feature_dbcrash' || '' }}
comments.body:
> If there are any downsides, you can skip the functional tests on the master branch completely on `job_id % n == 0`, where `n` is the down-scaling factor, but then run them completely otherwise?

Let's left it as is and see how it will go.
